data.title: Disney beats on core metrics and guides an upbeat profit growth for 2025
data.description:
Media conglomerate Disney (NYSE:DIS) beat on top and bottom line numbers for the first quarter and provided a forecast for the full year that sat well with Wall Street analysts.

DIS shares are flat in early premarket trading on the NYSE.

For the full year, the company expects adjusted earnings per share growth in the high single-digit range and cash flow from operations of about $15B. The Bloomberg consensus estimate for adj. EPS growth is 8.1%, and cash flow is $15.09B.

The company also expects to incur $200M related to Disney Cruise Line pre-opening expenses and record a $300M equity loss due to the purchase accounting of the Star India deconsolidation in 2025.

In Q2, the company expects a modest decline in Disney+ subscribers sequentially, and expects an impact of $100M on sports operating income from college sports and an additional NFL game, and about $50M from exiting the Venu Sports joint venture.

During Q1, total Disney+ subscribers came in at 124.6M, which included 56.8M domestic users and 67.8M internationally. Total Hulu subscribers were 53.6M.

Domestic Disney+ average monthly revenue per paid subscriber increased to $7.99 from $7.70, due to higher pricing, partially offset by a higher mix of subscribers to promotional offerings. International Disney+ average monthly revenue per paid subscriber increased to $7.19 from $6.78 due to higher pricing and advertising revenue, partially offset by a higher mix of subscribers to promotional offerings.

In his initial reaction to the report, Seeking Alpha analyst and leader of the Investing Group "Cash Flow Club," Jonathan Weber, said, "Disney delivered a double beat, growing slightly faster than expected. The Disney+ subscriber number declined sequentially, and the same is expected for the current quarter. That being said, other business units performed reasonably well, and management foresees a nice HSD EPS increase for the current year."

Net income for the three months ended December 31 was $2.64B, compared to $2.15B for the same period last year.

On a per-share basis, the company earned $1.40, beating the average analyst estimate by 9 cents.

Revenue rose 5% to $24.7B and was ahead of expectations by $150M.

data.title: Melexis Nv Ieper reports Q4 results
data.description:
• Melexis Nv Ieper press release (OTCPK:MLXSF): Sales for the fourth quarter of 2024 were 197.4 million EUR, a decrease of 21%.
  • The net result was 18.3 million EUR or 0.45 EUR per share, a decrease of 63%.
  • Outlook:
  • Melexis expects sales in the first quarter of 2025 to be in the range of 190 to 200 million EUR.
  • For the first half of 2025, Melexis expects sales to be around 400 million euro, with a gross profit margin around 40% and an operating margin around 16%, all taking into account a EUR/USD exchange rate of 1.03.
  • Sales in the second half of 2025 are expected to grow significantly compared to the first half of 2025. For the full year 2025, Melexis expects CAPEX to be around 50 million EUR.

  • For the first quarter 2025, Nordic expects a gross margin level of around 50%.

data.title: Are thinner people harming the environment? Novo emissions rise on Wegovy demand
data.description:
Novo Nordisk (NVO) said on Wednesday that its emissions rose by nearly a quarter in 2024 and will continue to increase up to 2030 as production increases to meet demand for its obesity blockbuster Wegovy.

In its 2024 annual report, Novo Nordisk said its scope 3 emissions, which account for 96% of its total, continue to rise. The drugmaker remains committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2045, and aims to cut scope 3 emissions by a third from 2024 to 2033.

These measures will include switching to low-carbon materials and feedstock in its production network, shifting distribution to low-emissions transportation and supporting suppliers in transitioning to renewable energy. More than 1,800 suppliers have committed to the transition, according to Novo Nordisk.

However, Katrine DiBona, vice president of sustainability at Novo Nordisk, told Reuters that some measures will not be available until years later, and emissions will continue to rise up to 2030.

While sustainability efforts have little impact on stock valuation, it will be interesting to see how its key rival Eli Lillyâs (LLY) emissions have been impacted by soaring demand for weight loss drugs. Wegovy added DKK 19.9B in sales in Q4, over a twofold rise from a year ago.

Eli Lilly (LLY) is due to report its own Q4 results tomorrow, with a consensus EPS estimate of $5.11 and revenue estimate of $13.42B for the quarter.

data.title: LiveWire Group GAAP EPS of -$0.11, revenue of $10.76M
data.description:
• LiveWire Group press release (NYSE:LVWR): Q4 GAAP EPS of -$0.11.
  • Revenue of $10.76M (-28.7% Y/Y).

  • For the full year 2025, the Company expects:

    • Electric Motorcycle sales of 1,000 to 1,500 revenue units
    • LiveWire Group operating loss of $70 to $80 million

  • Fourth Quarter 2024 Summary of Results

    • Unit sales of 236, a 138% increase over third quarter 2024
    • Consolidated operating loss decreased by $8.5 million from 2023 driven by a decrease in consolidated selling, administrative and engineering expense
    • Aligned the Companyâs go-to-market strategy with Europe moving to a wholesale model and entered Spain and Italy markets
